response_parsed.title: Implementing Batch Jobs Using FastAPI with Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This guide provides a comprehensive approach to implementing batch jobs using FastAPI, a modern web framework for building APIs, in conjunction with Python 3.12+.
key_points: Understanding the concept of batch processing and its importance in handling large data sets.
Setting up a virtual environment for your Python project.
Installing necessary packages: FastAPI, Uvicorn (ASGI server), apscheduler (for scheduling tasks) and any other required libraries.
Creating a FastAPI application to handle batch jobs submission, status checking, and results retrieval.
Implementing batch job functions and integrating them into the FastAPI application.
Configuring apscheduler for periodically running the batch job functions.
Setting up CLI (Command Line Interface) or API endpoints for starting and monitoring the batch jobs.
version_notes: Python 3.12+ is required for running this implementation.
caveats: Ensure you have configured your virtual environment correctly and installed all the necessary packages.
Batch job functions may require proper error handling and logging to ensure the system's stability and facilitate debugging.
